title: High Profile delegation from Japanese Foreign Ministry visits HIP
body_lines: Standing (from left): Port Investment Services AGM Lalith Ekanayake, MOFA Policy Coordination Division Assistant Director Nakada Taihaku, MOFA Foreign Policy Bureau Deputy Director Hamada Takashi, Hambantota International Port Services CEO Captain Ravi Jayawickreme, Corporate Affairs Junior Executive Ewmi Kurukulasuriya
The delegation had a bird’s eye view of the port from the 12th floor of the Hambantota Maritime Centre

A high level delegation from Japan’s Ministry of Foreign Affairs (MOFA) visited the Hambantota International Port (HIP), to get first-hand information on a wide range of subjects relating to port activity and the economy of the Southern part of Sri Lanka.

MOFA Foreign Policy Bureau Deputy Director Hamada Takashi and MOFA Policy Coordination Division Assistant Director Nakada Taihaku, led the delegation that met Hambantota International Port Services (HIPS) CEO Captain Ravi Jayawickreme, Commercial and Marketing Senior AGM Bindu Ranasinghe, and Port Investment Services AGM Lalith Ekanayake.
The delegation was briefed on current developments and the Port’s business model.
